Module kivakit.core
Package com.telenav.kivakit.core.language.primitive

Class Longs

java.lang.Object
com.telenav.kivakit.core.language.primitive.Longs
public class Longs extends Object
Utility methods for int values.

Parsing

  • parseFast(String) - Parses the given string, returning INVALID instead of throwing an exception. This can make a significant performance improvement when dealing with dirty data, because exceptions are expensive
  • parseFast(String, long) - Parses the given string returning the given flag value if parsing fails
  • parseFastNaturalNumber(String) - Parses a natural number, returning INVALID if parsing fails

Words

  • high(long) - Returns the high 32 bit word of the given long
  • low(long) - Returns the low 32 bit word of the given int
  • forHighLow(int, int) - Returns the two 32 bit words combined into a long

Ranges

  • inRangeInclusive(long, long, long) - Returns true if the given value is within the given range, inclusive
  • isBetweenInclusive(long, long, long) - Returns true if the given value is in the given range, inclusive
  • isBetweenExclusive(long, long, long) - Returns true if the given value is in the given range, exclusive

String Conversion

  • commaSeparated(long) - Converts the given value to a comma-separated string
  • toHex(long) - Converts the given int to a hexadecimal string
  • toHex(long, long) - Converts the given value to a hexadecimal string of the given length
Author:
jonathanl (shibo)

    • parseFast

      public static long parseFast(String string, long invalid)
      Yes, it turns out that Long.parseLong(String) is a major hotspot due to the fact that it throws a NumberFormatException instead of returning a signal value.
      Returns:
      An integer value or the specified invalid value if the string is not a valid integer

    • parseFastNaturalNumber

      public static long parseFastNaturalNumber(String string)
      Yes, it turns out that Integer.parseInt(String) is a major hotspot due to the fact that it throws a NumberFormatException instead of returning a signal value.
      Returns:
      A natural number for the string or -1 if the string is not a natural number

    • random

      public static long random(Random random, long minimum, long maximumExclusive)
      NOTE: This (poorly documented) method is verbatim from java.util.Random.java. It is being used because the task of finding a random long between two longs involves complex overflow issues and this code has been tested.

      The form of nextLong used by LongStream Spliterators. If origin is greater than bound, acts as unbounded form of nextLong, else as bounded form.

      Parameters:
      minimum - the least value, unless greater than bound
      maximumExclusive - the upper bound (exclusive), must not equal origin
      Returns:
      a pseudorandom value

    • searchWords

      public static boolean searchWords(long value, int bits, int searchFor)
      Parameters:
      value - The value to search
      bits - The word length
      searchFor - The value to locate
      Returns:
      True if the value contains the search term in the words
